revised_title: Ovulation Rate Regulation After Unilateral Ovariectomy in Mice
tldr: The study investigates the mechanism behind the increased ovulation rate in mice after the removal of one ovary. The research supports the hypothesis that the remaining ovary consumes more follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) during ovulation, determining the number of eggs shed based on the duration of hormonal stimulus rather than the absolute hormone level in the blood.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
